lines: WARNING - THIS EPISODE CONTAINS SUBJECT MATTER OF A SEXUAL NATURE.

You're sitting with ${loverName} in the living room. The lights are low, and the two of you are very cozy. ${loverName} begins to get VERY romantic, and you respond in kind. He explains that he would really like to make love with you, but doesn't have
any birth control. What will you do?
#SUGGEST THAT YOU SATISFY ONE ANOTHER WITHOUT HAVING INTERCOURSE
#TELL HIM TO RUN OUT AND GET SOME CONDOMS
#TELL HIM IT'S O.K. AS LONG AS HE PULLS OUT BEFORE EJACULATING
That's a nice alternative. The two of you chose a safe, sensible way out of your dilemma. You have a very enjoyable time.

After 35 minutes of searching, ${loverName} finally finds a drugstore that is open late. He purchases the condoms and rushes back. By this time, you have fallen asleep in the living room and do not answer the door!
${loverName} gets to sleep in the car tonight!
Yes, of course -- and the moon is made of green cheese -- and one day flying pigs will break the sound barrier. Haven't you played this game long enough to know what could happen? Well, it doesn't.

Luckily, the statistics are with you, and you don't become pregnant. In case you didn't know, pulling out is no guarantee that you will not get pregnant. This is true, by the way, regardless of which day of your menstrual cycle you are
in. There are NO 100% safe times.
"Here we go again," you think to yourself. ${loverName} tries to convince you, but you are determined.
